articles.headline: Undeterred by White House Threat, Democrats Push Impeachment Inquiry Ahead
articles.snippet: Democrats want to test the limits of the White House’s refusal to hand over documents and witnesses related to Ukraine.
articles.abstract: Democrats want to test the limits of the White House’s refusal to hand over documents and witnesses related to Ukraine.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Democrats prepared on Wednesday to force the Trump administration anew to answer questions in their impeachment investigation, one day after President Trump and the White House declared that they would defy Congress in one of the most extraordinary assertions of executive authority in modern times.

articles.headline: PG&E Outage Darkens Northern California Amid Wildfire Threat
articles.snippet: A deliberate power outage by the state’s largest utility sent residents scrambling — and debating whether it was worth it.
articles.abstract: A deliberate power outage by the state’s largest utility sent residents scrambling — and debating whether it was worth it.

articles.headline: Trump’s Sweeping Case Against Impeachment Is a Political Strategy
articles.snippet: At its core, it is born out of the cold calculation that President Trump probably cannot stop the Democrat-led House from impeaching him.
articles.abstract: At its core, it is born out of the cold calculation that President Trump probably cannot stop the Democrat-led House from impeaching him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Breathtaking in scope, defiant in tone, the White House’s refusal to cooperate with the House impeachment inquiry amounts to an unabashed challenge to America’s longstanding constitutional order.

articles.headline: Apple Removes App That Helps Hong Kong Protesters Track the Police
articles.snippet: Apple said it was removing the HKmap.live app, which was criticized by Chinese state media, because the Hong Kong authorities said protesters used it to attack the police.
articles.abstract: Apple said it was removing the HKmap.live app, which was criticized by Chinese state media, because the Hong Kong authorities said protesters used it to attack the police.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple removed an app late Wednesday that enabled protesters in Hong Kong to track the police, a day after facing intense criticism from Chinese state media for it, plunging the technology giant deeper into the complicated politics of a country that is fundamental to its business.

articles.headline: The Radical Guidebook Embraced by Google Workers and Uber Drivers
articles.snippet: A book based on ideas associated with a labor group from the early 20th century has provided a blueprint for organizing without a formal union.
articles.abstract: A book based on ideas associated with a labor group from the early 20th century has provided a blueprint for organizing without a formal union.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just before 20,000 Google employees left their desks last fall to protest the company’s handling of sexual harassment, a debate broke out among the hundreds of workers involved in formulating a list of demands.

articles.headline: China Trade Talks Restart as White House Explores Escalation Options
articles.snippet: Expectations for a limited deal grew, even as the Trump administration separately considered limiting China’s access to U.S. capital markets and imposing greater scrutiny on Chinese companies.
articles.abstract: Expectations for a limited deal grew, even as the Trump administration separately considered limiting China’s access to U.S. capital markets and imposing greater scrutiny on Chinese companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American and Chinese officials met for the 13th round of trade negotiations on Thursday amid growing expectations of a limited deal that could ease tensions and address some of President Trump’s concerns about China’s economic practices.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Ana Swanson

articles.headline: When a Steady Paycheck Is Good Medicine
articles.snippet: American medical providers that collectively spend $50 billion per year are channeling work to local businesses and residents.
articles.abstract: American medical providers that collectively spend $50 billion per year are channeling work to local businesses and residents.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Growing up in the Baldwin Village section of Los Angeles, Charles Slay roamed the streets as a member of the Bloods. The neighborhood was forlorn and devoid of commercial life, making it easy ground for ambush — especially a ragged patch of dirt alongside a major thoroughfare.

articles.headline: 2 Giuliani Associates Arrested With One-Way Tickets at U.S. Airport
articles.snippet: Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman, associates of President Trump’s personal lawyer, were part of the pressure campaign on Ukraine to investigate Democrats.
articles.abstract: Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman, associates of President Trump’s personal lawyer, were part of the pressure campaign on Ukraine to investigate Democrats.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Federal prosecutors unsealed charges on Thursday against two men who have aided President Trump’s efforts to gather damaging information in Ukraine about his political opponents, a criminal case that signaled growing legal exposure for the president’s allies as Mr. Trump tries to blunt an impeachment inquiry in Congress.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti, Eileen Sullivan, Adam Goldman and William K. Rashbaum
